member.name: T:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility
member.summary: Provides helper methods for working with COM IDispatch objects that have a registered type library.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.ImplementsIDispatch(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets whether the specified object implements IDispatch.
member.param: An object to check.
member.returns: True if the object implements IDispatch. False otherwise.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.GetType(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a Type that can be used with reflection.
member.param: An object that implements IDispatch.
Whether an exception should be thrown if a Type can't be obtained.
member.returns: A .NET Type that can be used with reflection.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.TryGetDispId(System.Object,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Tries to get the DISPID for the requested member name.
member.param: An object that implements IDispatch.
The name of a member to lookup.
If the method returns true, this holds the DISPID on output. If the method returns false, this value should be ignored.
member.returns: True if the member was found and resolved to a DISPID. False otherwise.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.Invoke(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object[])
member.param: An object that implements IDispatch.
The DISPID of a member. This can be obtained using .
The arguments to pass to the member.
member.remarks: This can invoke a method or a property get accessor.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.Invoke(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.param: An object.
The name of the member to invoke.
The arguments to pass to the member.
member.remarks: This can invoke a method or a property get accessor.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.RequireReference``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Requires that the value is non-null.
member.param: The value to check.
The name of the value.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.GetType(TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.IDispatchInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a Type that can be used with reflection.
member.param: An object that implements IDispatch.
Whether an exception should be thrown if a Type can't be obtained.
member.returns: A .NET Type that can be used with reflection.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.TryGetDispId(TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.IDispatchInfo,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Tries to get the DISPID for the requested member name.
member.param: An object that implements IDispatch.
The name of a member to lookup.
If the method returns true, this holds the DISPID on output. If the method returns false, this value should be ignored.
member.returns: True if the member was found and resolved to a DISPID. False otherwise.

member.name: T:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.IDispatchInfo
member.summary: A partial declaration of IDispatch used to lookup Type information and DISPIDs.
member.remarks:
This interface only declares the first three methods of IDispatch. It omits the fourth method (Invoke) because there are already plenty of ways to do dynamic invocation in .NET. But the first three methods provide dynamic type metadata discovery, which .NET doesn't provide normally if you have a System.__ComObject RCW instead of a strongly-typed RCW.
Note: The original declaration of IDispatch is in OAIdl.idl.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.IDispatchInfo.GetTypeInfoCount(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the number of Types that the object provides (0 or 1).
member.param: Returns 0 or 1 for the number of Types provided by .

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.IDispatchInfo.GetTypeInfo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Type@)
member.summary: Gets the Type information for an object if returned 1.
member.param: Must be 0.
Typically, LOCALE_SYSTEM_DEFAULT (2048).
Returns the object's Type information.

member.name: M:TestDispatchUtility.DispatchUtility.IDispatchInfo.GetDispId(System.Guid@,System.String@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the DISPID of the specified member name.
member.param: Must be IID_NULL. Pass a copy of Guid.Empty.
The name of the member to look up.
Must be 1.
Typically, LOCALE_SYSTEM_DEFAULT (2048).
If a member with the requested is found, this returns its DISPID and the method's return value is 0. If the method returns a non-zero value, then this parameter's output value is undefined.
member.returns: Zero for success. Non-zero for failure.
